results.title: Muscular and mechanical movements
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Digestion”.
Deals with the muscular processes involved in the digestion of food. The film demonstrates mechanical and muscular processes of mastication and swallowing; peristalsis in the oesophagus, small intestine, and colon; segmentation in the small intestine; contraction waves in the cardiac and pyloric regions of the stomach; absorption of food into the blood from the small intestine, and of water and salts from the colon. No other credits available.

group_siblings.title: Chemical changes
group_siblings.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey and Gaumont-British Instructional

results.title: Chemical changes
results.creator_credit: Beryl Denman Lacey and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Digestion”.
An account of the chief changes involved in the chemical breakdown of the main types of food during digestion. Shows the secretion of saliva and its action on cooked starch; the gastric glands; secretion of intestinal bile and pancreatic juice and their effect on proteins, carbohydrates and fats; the absorption of nutrients through the villi and lacteals into the blood and its subsequent circulation through the body.

results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This work is a video clip featuring the band, “Euphoriac” performing one of their songs.

results.title: Weirdo
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
The story of a ‘weirdo’ guy, who’s best friend is a bird. They shop together and and live in harmony, until the ‘weirdo’ guy’s evil twin brother steals the bird. ‘Weirdo’ guy goes in pursuit of his evil twin brother up a mountain in a desperate attempt to save his best friend. A struggle ensues and, whilst ‘Weirdo’ manages to save his best friend, alas, his evil twin brother falls to his death off the mountain edge.

results.title: A Short film
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This short work features a lonely boy dealing with the pain of peer pressure, abuse by fellow students and the depression he suffers as a result. It continues on until he can’t cope with it any longer and writes a suicide note in his diary. He goes to the uppermost floor of a skyscraper and meets a lonely girl up there - seemingly suffering the same feelings. Together they jump into the abyss below.

results.title: Nuggit & Goofs
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short recounts the story of ‘Nuggit’, an alien and his friend ‘Goofs’ the horse as they go on an exciting adventure into the deep dark forest. They are scared out of their wits as they are surrendered and attacked by enormous black killer spiders. They flee from the forest, never to return.

results.title: Nine lives
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Using multiple locations such as Bourke Street, school playgrounds and the beach, a group of students show us their acrobatic abilities, jumping off sides of wallls, sculptures and common school playground equipment.

results.title: Monica Street
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
This animated short story features a girls’ journey walking along a street called ‘Monica Street’. She encounters an art gallery; music shop and a costume shop. The end of her journey sees her being invited to a Jewish meal at her friend’s house.
